alert.note: Alert for Eastern Mogollon Rim; Little Colorado River Valley in Coconino County; Oak Creek and Sycamore Canyons; Western Mogollon Rim (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 8:20PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Coconino County through 845 PM MST... At 820 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Mountainaire to 9 miles south of Twin Arrows to 7 miles northeast of Tremaine Lake to 17 miles east of Starlight Pines. Movement was southwest at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Munds Park, Dairy Springs Campground, Starlight Pines, Mormon Lake, Tremaine Lake, Upper Lake Mary, Chevelon Canyon Dam, Rock Crossing Campground, Chevelon Butte, Pinegrove Campground, Chevelon Canyon Lake Campground, Lake View Campground, Chavez Mountain, Double Springs Campground, Upper Lake Mary Boat Ramps, Manzanita Campground, Blue Ridge Campground, Long Lake, Chevelon Crossing Campground and Lower Lake Mary. This includes the following highways... Interstate 17 between mile markers 318 and 330. State Route 89A near mile marker 380. State Route 87 between mile markers 294 and 319. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until these storms pass.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Mogollon Rim; Little Colorado River Valley in Coconino County; Oak Creek and Sycamore Canyons; Western Mogollon Rim
